        Specified by:

      • supportsMultipleObjectSelection

        public boolean supportsMultipleObjectSelection()
        Determines whether the model support multiple Node selection.
        Specified by:
        supportsMultipleObjectSelection in interface GraphSelectionModel
        Returns:
        Returns true if multiple Node selection is supported. Returns false if the model does not support multiple Node selection.

      • getSelectedObject

        public Object getSelectedObject()
        Gets the first selected Object. In a single selection model, this will obviously be the only selected Object.
        Specified by:
        getSelectedObject in interface GraphSelectionModel
        Returns:
        The selected Object. If no Objects are selected, then the return value is null.

      • getSelectedObjects

        public Object[] getSelectedObjects()
        Retrieves an array of the selected Objects. In a single selection model, this will be an array containing a maximum of one Object.
        Specified by:
        getSelectedObjects in interface GraphSelectionModel
        Returns:
        An array of the selected Objects. If no Objects are selected, then the array will be empty.

      • addGraphSelectionModelListener

        public void addGraphSelectionModelListener(GraphSelectionModelListener lsnr)
        Adds a listener that is informed of changes in the selection.
        Specified by:
        addGraphSelectionModelListener in interface GraphSelectionModel
        Parameters:
        lsnr - The GraphSelectionModelListener to be added.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the object. In general, the toString method returns a string that "textually represents" this object. The result should be a concise but informative representation that is easy for a person to read. It is recommended that all subclasses override this method.

        The toString method for class Object returns a string consisting of the name of the class of which the object is an instance, the at-sign character `@', and the unsigned hexadecimal representation of the hash code of the object. In other words, this method returns a string equal to the value of: 

         getClass().getName() + '@' + Integer.toHexString(hashCode())
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        a string representation of the object.
